intro: Hieracium smolandicum subsp. pectinigerum, commonly known as the Sømland hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of northern Europe. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in meadows and grasslands. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowering stems bear yellow composite flowers, which are arranged in a head with both ray and disk florets. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and is often found in open, disturbed habitats.
